content: @WG-async-sprint-planning Reminder that the sprint planning meeting is happening in 2 days. You can check the sprint goals in the meeting doc.
tmandry has marked this topic as unresolved.
@WG-async-sprint-planning Time for sprint planning!
Planning doc
(sorry, trying to find link to join chat)
it's on Zulip, @pnkfelix
lol

Agenda

  • Sprint retrospective
  • Assign polish issues
  • Identify sprint goals
First, let's take a few minutes to update the sprint items from the last sprint in the doc.
@eholk is the plan for liveness based capture still to focus on the drop work?
Yup!
• Eric and I met and discussed the overall strategy. The plan is to pursue more limited changes to begin, focusing on "moved values". --nikomatsakis
I wrote that in the doc

Ill update the doc, all of these should be mergeable, (except the last Ill add a regression test today)

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89610
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89826
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89787

Ill be gone for most of the next sprint (for like 10 days starting next tuesday), but I believe/hope they are mergeable with little/no changes
okay, cool
all done here :)
@Gus Wynn - I saw you added those PRs onto the previous sprint. Would you like me to move them up to the current sprint?
Oh sorry, misplaced!
I think we can move on while last edits take place :)
Sprint retrospective
What went well?
I finally did something
As usual, having concrete goals for ourselves was really helpful.
Tyler and I spent an hour co-hacking on the RFC draft yesterday I think specifically because we said we would :)
Agreed. I got to check off most of my concrete goals and had less to show for my more vague goals
I do think having commitments with actual people, in the form of scheduled meeting times, can be an amazing driver for work
I took an afternoon focused on updating the polish pages, and I think I'll do a similar thing for this sprint

nikomatsakis said:

Tyler and I spent an hour co-hacking on the RFC draft yesterday I think specifically because we said we would :)

yes, it definitely nudged us in the direction of focusing on the more important stuff
Nice :)
What things didn't go well / could be improved?
Didn’t go well: I still haven’t touched my promised polish issue. (I’m generally over-extended but about to be less so.)
Me either :(
(On my issue)
I guess in the case of async fundamentals, we didn't complete one of our tasks
I just didn't prioritize it, I'll carry it over to this time

tmandry said:

I guess in the case of async fundamentals, we didn't complete one of our tasks

Yeah, which is interesting. It got kind of half done.
Maybe that just says we're still doing more than is realistic
I think I'm in a good place with the polish issue, but it requires... deep expertise to review to make sure I'm not outright incorrect

tmandry said:

I guess in the case of async fundamentals, we didn't complete one of our tasks

right, as in: plan is outlined … what does that mean? that you have recommendation without discussing alternatives?

I've been keeping both a polish issue and a longer term bug (the generator captures). I think for this sprint I might unassign myself from the polish issue and use generator captures as my polish issue. I think being more focused would help.
Or at least better reflect what I actually did :)

nikomatsakis said:

tmandry said:

I guess in the case of async fundamentals, we didn't complete one of our tasks

Yeah, which is interesting. It got kind of half done.

Yeah, not the end of the world but worth noting I guess

pnkfelix said:

right, as in: plan is outlined … what does that mean?

(I’ll just go look)

pnkfelix said:

right, as in: plan is outlined … what does that mean? that you have recommendation without discussing alternatives?

yes :) although I ahve the alternatives outlined in a separate doc
that's older
I started work on my prototype, but it's nowhere close to complete: not having someone else makes me move slower than I otherwise could to push me to publish more often...
I just didn't get it in a combined place

pnkfelix said:

tmandry said:

I guess in the case of async fundamentals, we didn't complete one of our tasks

right, as in: plan is outlined … what does that mean? that you have recommendation without discussing alternatives?

I think what we meant more concretely was "there's a page on the initiative site that describes what we want to do"
I was thinking @Esteban Küber that maybe you need a "buddy" :)
maybe I do too
I don't know who that would be, of course
I may be buddy-able at some point
@Esteban Küber maybe you and I can establish, what, an hour each week where we just agree to program together, with video going live?
is that the word for "able to be a buddy"?
I don’t know if that will help, its not the same as true pair-programming
twitch stream!

Gus Wynn said:

is that the word for "able to be a buddy"?

It is now!
@Esteban Küber seriously, what did get done, and what problems did you encounter?

pnkfelix said:

Esteban Küber maybe you and I can establish, what, an hour each week where we just agree to program together, with video going live?

I have heard this referred to as "body doubling" and it works for some people!

nikomatsakis said:

Esteban Küber seriously, what did get done, and what problems did you encounter?

yeah, tell us more about state of prototype?

Esteban Küber said:

I started work on my prototype, but it's nowhere close to complete: not having someone else makes me move slower than I otherwise could to push me to publish more often...

also, is it possible more granularly scoped tasks would help?

@nikomatsakis I introduced a new item to a local branch, trying to work towards having iterator items that I can actually iterate on. I haven't pushed that because I didn't have anyone to bounce ideas from ^_^'
OK. I'd be game to join a "coding focus time" with you + @pnkfelix potentially!
if that might help

tmandry said:

Esteban Küber said:

I started work on my prototype, but it's nowhere close to complete: not having someone else makes me move slower than I otherwise could to push me to publish more often...

also, is it possible more granularly scoped tasks would help?

I have started a hackmd of my a-priori thoughts on scoped-tasks (I need to move it into the async-foundations hackmd team), its not done, but for next sprints (once im back) I want to continue working on that

the prototype right now adds a new item type and an attribute intrinsic to annotate function items
at the moment it completely ignores the bodies and returns an impl Iterator<Item=YieldType> (YieldType comes from #[iterator(yields = YieldType)])
(or if you want you can setup a 1:1 time for us to poke at, let's discuss offline)

Gus Wynn said:

I have started a hackmd of my a-priori thoughts on scoped-tasks (I need to move it into the async-foundations hackmd team), its not done, but for next sprints (once im back) I want to continue working on that

wait, I’m not sure you’re talking abou the same kind of “scoped task"
yeah, I'm also open to scheduling time to be a rubber duck for ideas etc.
@tmandry if you have pointers on recommended practices for body doubling (e.g. focus on vidoe of people? or of their screens?), I’d love to see them.

pnkfelix said:

Gus Wynn said:

I have started a hackmd of my a-priori thoughts on scoped-tasks (I need to move it into the async-foundations hackmd team), its not done, but for next sprints (once im back) I want to continue working on that

wait, I’m not sure you’re talking abou the same kind of “scoped task"

oh lmao im lost in the sauce
(done with retro?)
I know that some people enjoyed (for some weird reason) the video I put out for a small change. I guess some people would watch a stream of our work?

pnkfelix said:

tmandry if you have pointers on recommended practices for body doubling (e.g. focus on vidoe of people? or of their screens?), I’d love to see them.

I don't have much experience with it, but I believe it's focusing on people, you join a scheduled session, tell people what you're going to get done, then get to work
it might also work as a record to pull historical decisions from as well...
might feel like more of a "performance" in that case, idk. try something and see what works :)

I think we can
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

next up is

Polish issues
Here's the project board
Let's take a few minutes to decide what we're doing and write it down in the doc
You can react with :checkered_flag: when you're done
I'm between #74256 and #60658 :)
I guess I'll try picking up the first. Having some shared context with @eholk might help
Oh yeah, that seems like a good one.
If you want to meet to discuss it / pair program sometime this sprint, I'm happy to

tmandry said:

I'm between #74256 and #60658 :)

that one is sort of amusing
the compiler is so certain about what it's telling you :)
(also @Gauri Kholkar rocked those errors :)
my brain fries when I try to distinguish p_sub and p_sup when I read that code lol
is anyone still working on picking a polish issue?
if not, we can move on
(I'm still choosing, but I can take https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/66731)
re wrong lifetime span: that's likely "just" because of the desugaring, it should be "trivially" special cased for async fns
okay, let's see if I can figure it out :)
yes, I'm sure it finds that the origin is "some part" of the first argument
which is self
okay, I think we can move on to sprint planning
Sprint goals
the non polish part, I mean
unless you're @eholk :)
maybe we should come up with a different term to distinguish the types of work
I've been subdividing it into issues and goals, but goals is kind of overloaded...
(updating the doc) :time_ticking:
@tmandry I am wondering whether @Santiago Pastorino is here; we might want to put some part of prototyping on the list of goals
ooh, that would be cool
(let me know if where I put my own personal goal (vague on purpose this sprint) in a different place

nikomatsakis said:

tmandry I am wondering whether Santiago Pastorino is here; we might want to put some part of prototyping on the list of goals

yeah, I think the next thing for progress will be having a prototype implementation of the non-MVP parts of the design
which obviously depends on having the MVP implemented
I'm here but I had no idea there was a sprint planning meeting, going to add myself to the zulip group because I'm not part of the zulip meeting group
also, would be nice if we add this to the calendar :)
yeah sorry, we should do all of that (I have an event but not on a shared calendar)

Gus Wynn said:

(let me know if where I put my own personal goal (vague on purpose this sprint) in a different place

re: scoped spawning, there's a lot of context here
I guess some of that is on the website
You’re thinking of things like the tokio’s bug about it? Let me see if I can find it again quickly
My understanding is that there is little progress on what an implementation would look like, thats what I'm looking into now
I think there are two separable parts
but @nikomatsakis and I think it requires some pretty disruptive changes, so we haven't prioritized it while working out some of the more basic stuff
One is the language changes to make it sound
The other is "assume we did that, what API could we have?"
So...what should we write @tmandry :) feeling a bit unsure. I guess that a first step for prototype would be "extend parser"

pnkfelix said:

You’re thinking of things like the tokio’s bug about it? Let me see if I can find it again quickly

I was thinking of this, BTW: https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/issues/3162
except that's basically already done
so I guess the next goal is to basically...uh...attempt the desugaring? :)
"come up with implementation plan"? :)

nikomatsakis said:

One is the language changes to make it sound

are the changes required here written down somewhere? my personal conclusion was also that the language would have to change
@Gus Wynn the website covers the main approaches
https://rust-lang.github.io/wg-async-foundations/vision/roadmap/scopes/capability.html
I personally am less interested in seeing exploration on that front
and more interested in exploring the "What could we do with it"

nikomatsakis said:

so I guess the next goal is to basically...uh...attempt the desugaring? :)

but yes, I think so
in terms of the "design space" past the MVP, I'm feeling a bit unsure what's the next step.
wait, which goal are we talking about now? Scoped tasks still?
there are two separate "minithreads"

nikomatsakis said:

in terms of the "design space" past the MVP, I'm feeling a bit unsure what's the next step.

here I meant for "async fns in traits"
I think, @tmandry, one thing I am doing now is working on a blog post outlining how you can model "dyn" in userspace
almost done
maybe the gaols we have are good enough
the next obvious frontiers are dyn support and naming the return type

nikomatsakis said:

https://rust-lang.github.io/wg-async-foundations/vision/roadmap/scopes/capability.html

The part I was thinking about was, if a task borrows from the stack of another executing task, then the thread borrowed from must be blocked (ie, can't yield) until the sub-task finishes. But blocking an executor thread is a no-no. But ill read these docs again, closer!

nikomatsakis said:

maybe the gaols we have are good enough

oh, wait
we should add "convene a stakeholder meeting"

nikomatsakis said:

in terms of the "design space" past the MVP, I'm feeling a bit unsure what's the next step.

I think the immediate next step for implementation is the ::Output types, but it interacts with dyn some
and also, I think I would like to try and gather some data about potential impact of box/dyn
although most folks I know are using #[async_trait], so it will surely be less :)

nikomatsakis said:

we should add "convene a stakeholder meeting"

also we should find a new name... but anyway

nikomatsakis said:

we should add "convene a stakeholder meeting"

yeah, or at least get one on the books..
should we review each others' goals? :)
sounds good

Async fundamentals

  • [ ] Post the RFC draft
  • [ ] Write up the alternatives for naming async-fn-in-trait return types and come up with a recommendation (carried over)
  • [ ] Desugaring for MVP RFC
    * [ ] Prototype
    * [ ] Put up PR with tests
  • [ ] Schedule stakeholder meeting to discuss the MVP RFC and overall plan

Async iteration

  • [ ] Publish WIP prototype basic sync iterator item for feedback

Scoped Spawning Apis

  • [ ] (guswynn) continue collecting a-priori knowledge

Polish

Goals:

  • [ ] (eholk) Write "how to get involved" instructions for Polish area.

Issues:

  • [ ] Better output when .awaiting on sync fn #66731 (estebank)
    Suggest removal of .await or turning fn into async fn (if the types are correct and the transform would be valid). Looking at the ticket history, we could get away with adding Spans to DesugaringKind pointing at the suggestion places (to avoid changing the crate dep tree).

  • [ ] [#89734 waiting on review] Unhelpful compiler message when a reference is used inside of an await block #723120 (estebank)
    Objective: land

  • [ ] (guswynn) warn on must_use in async fn's https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89610
    * May also need a change to async-trait
    Objective: land

  • [ ] (guswynn) Clean up must_not_suspend until we fix the capture code, both:
    * https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89787
    * https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89826
    Objective: land

  • [ ] (nikomatsakis) Async function leads to a "more general type" error #71723

  • [ ] (pnkfelix) Indexing via index method and [idx] sugar works differently in async blocks/functions #72956
  • [ ] (eholk) Dropped variables still included in generator type #57478 (part of #69663)
  • [ ] (tmandry) E0623 highlights wrong parameter in async fn #74256
Cool
Any other thoughts, questions, comments?
@pnkfelix any planned things over next few weeks?
Hmm I thought Ihad a tooling section on there
oops
my bad

Tooling

  • [ ] (pnkfelix) post console preview to crates.io

the only other thing I’m considering is also making a screencast demoing console on a concrete problem I’ve been working on. But I don’t want to promise that for this sprint. More realistic to plan it for the sprint after this one.
cool
less is more (imo) when it comes to these goals
I will say I think these sprint goals are more specific than last time, which is good
also, +1 to "PR with tests" as the first step
good thinking, whoever wrote that :)

okay, I'm going to
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
I'm going to work on that T::Output evaluation doc right now :)

tmandry said:

I will say I think these sprint goals are more specific than last time, which is good

It feels like we're getting a lot better at planning these sprints. It's nice to see the continual refinement working!
I agree!
Thanks for participating, everyone
Thanks for running things, @tmandry !
I'm looking forward to seeing how experiments in working together go :)
Until next time... :wave:
tmandry has marked this topic as resolved.
